website_summaries.verdict: Notice a dramatic reduction in vomit caused by hairballs after just a few uses.
pros: Reduces vomiting caused by hairballs after just a few uses
A little gel goes a long way
cons: Gel is quite runny, making it tough to apply without a mess

customer_reviews.title: Cat Crack
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this stuff. He sucks it right out of the tube. He sits perfectly upright and holds the tube with his front paws. The product does help prevent hair balls. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: HDV

customer_reviews.title: Amazing improvement
customer_reviews.text: I have an older cat who has issues with regularity. I have tried many brands of hairball control products with moderate success. I used to use Laxatone for my cats many years ago but haven't seen it in pet stores or at the vet's in some time. Searched Amazon and thought I'd try it again. The difference was immediate and surprising. My cat is now completely regular with softer stool. Plus her appetite has really improved. We're both a lot happier now that she's so much more comfortable. I highly recommend this product whether for just an occasional use or for the difficult cases like my senior cat.
customer_reviews.author: CathieQ

customer_reviews.title: Cats not super crazy about eating it by choice so I started ...
customer_reviews.text: I think (hope) it's helping, Cats not super crazy about eating it by choice so I started wiping on paws - bad idea unless you want them to wipe it on your floor as they run away. Switched to wiping on nose and made less but they still didn't enjoy it. Finally got smart and started mixing in their wet food every few days - success!
customer_reviews.author: Cora

customer_reviews.title: We gave this product a three using the following logic ...
customer_reviews.text: We gave this product a three using the following logic: The product itself is a five, the product container (squeeze tube) is a zero. No matter what you do the tube leaks from the bottom. Generally when it arrives there is leakage in the package. If you lay the tube on a counter and come back later there is leakage on the counter. It has been this way for years so the manufacturer doesn't seem to care.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Franey

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended to me by my local Vet for use on my mature cat who has, sometimes severe, problems passing stool. I administer this as directed by the Vet daily and it seems to do the trick. He has frequent, regular stools and has little to no difficulty passing them. He also loves the taste of this product, and licks it right off my finger, making it the most easily administered medication ever.
customer_reviews.author: divvip

customer_reviews.title: Best hairball treatment for my cat ever he loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I've had trouble getting my cat to take any hair ball treatments forever he wouldn't eat them at all and when he would it never seemed to help. My sister in law showed me this product that she gives her two cats and the reacted like it was a treat! She gave me a half a tube to let my cat try it and he actually enjoys it so I purchased the three pack and so for he has not had a hairball attack since I have started using this product! I put a small amount ontop of his wet food and he enjoys every bit of it! I can't recommend high enough!
customer_reviews.author: Kandee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for molting bunnies
customer_reviews.text: Smells incredible, and works great! Bunnies cannot vomit, so when they get hair in their bellies, it's painful. They require a high fiber diet of hay, and since one of mine is a lionhead, I supplement with 100% pure pumpkin, but it wasn't enough. I was advised by our Vet to get Laxatone, and was told about the maple flavour. My little guy hates it (which means it works!) And my girl bunny LOVES it. It's very thick, but smells like syrup. Her poops have improved, and his have also gotten better- especially during molting. I give them about 1ml a week, and it is helping so far!
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: SHE ATE IT?!?  SHE ATE IT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats, one that will eat anything you put in front of it and one that will only eat if the universe is aligned, the food is the right temperate and it's been blessed by angels. I can NEVER get hairball remedy or treats down her without a knockdown, drag-out, WWE match. But THIS...THIS SHE EATS. WILLINGLY! It like laple syrup, so be ready for a bit of a mess when preparing, but it WORKS, and it's tasty according to the finickyist of cats. Tuna flavor FTW!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Van Loon

customer_reviews.title: Preferred.  Excellent product.  Vet recommmended,
customer_reviews.text: No problems, arrived on time, product was properly sealed and fresh. My vet prescribed this for wellness, fortunately my kitty, who sheds a Lot, loves to lick it gently from my finger, so no issues. Daily use - it helps her tummy by keeping that hair moving on thru instead of balling up for throwing up. I really, really like it better than alternatives available to me locally which are just so chock full of paragraphs of unpronounceable chemicals. This is mostly made up of maple or tuna flavored white petroleum, it helps her, and doesn’t seem to harm her in any way thus far. Glad I can get this thru Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Bassvamp

customer_reviews.title: Works eventually.
customer_reviews.text: Took a couple days to be effective but it ultimately solved my cat's constipation problem. Ordered the salmon flavor because I doubted the finicky little beast would like any other or would at least hate it less. What I received was maple flavor. Cat doesn't like anything that isn't actual cat food so we always windup struggling with her to get her to take it; the solution being to put it on the backs of her paws where she HAS to lick it off. I came to the conclusion that it was a happy accident that we received the maple flavor. Having a cat and furniture, etc. smell like pancakes rather than fish is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Works Kitty Loves it...
customer_reviews.text: My kitty is an senior kitty who has trouble with pooping. Our Vet suggested this product. We thought at first we were going to have trouble administering this to her. Nope, not at all almost the total opposite. She loves the stuff. We have to limit her. She is right there when it is time for her medicine (gel) She knows the schedule, which is nice but on the weekends can be trying. It works. Great product. Good value..We give it five Paws...
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Preston

customer_reviews.title: Great lax for my rabbits!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my rabbits when they are blowing their coats. Works great to clear out any fur from their digestive tract that might have built up from self grooming. I give 1cc of the maple flavored laxatone by mouth once daily for 3 days during active shedding (when there are visible tufts of fur coming out of the coat). Great value as well. Amazon carries the larger size for less than what I was paying for the smaller size at my exotics vet clinic. Also, the tube has a generous expiration date. Very pleased bun mom over here.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie LynTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Probably works - if you can get your cat to eat it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 12 year old cat that has recently started having hairball issues. I'm sure this product works as intended - if I were able to get my cat to take it. I've tried enticing her with it on my finger, I've mixed it in with her food. I've even tried smearing it on her face. She doesn't like it. The packaging leaves a lot to be desired. I closed it with the cap, and came in the next morning to find out leaking out around the cap.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Can't really recommend, it did not help at all.
customer_reviews.text: My cat has some digestion issues where she gets a bit backed up to the point where it irritates her stomach and she'll throw up every few days. I was super excited to get this laxative to help her. I gave her the directed dosage, it didn't work after a couple weeks. I even upped the dosage and that did not work, either. She REALLY hated the taste and would move her head away from it and just duck and cover from it. My other cat isn't as picky, but even she didn't want any after taking one lick. So now I'm off to try different products to help my cat and now I just need to toss this out.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Avoids Hairball Buildup in Stomach
customer_reviews.text: My cat is more than willing to eat this as a treat from a little dish, which is fortunate for me, because the vet who recommended this warned me that I'd have to almost force it down her throat, etc. But she'll eat it like a treat. The product gets runny in warmer weather, and so I keep it in the fridge. Otherwise, it sticks up the cap and the end of the tube and can be pretty messy. Seems, overall, to be helping a lot. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Elaine in Vermont

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping hair balls away!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Maine coon cat and she gets bad hair balls. After brushing her a couple times a week I give her a dime size amount and it seems to keep the hair balls at bay. She likes the flavor too. This is the same kind the vet office I worked at used. So I know it’s good. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great for making hairballs easier to cough up in long-haired ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for making hairballs easier to cough up in long-haired cats. I give each cat a 1/2 inch strip of laxatone orally once a week. It prevents serious digestive disorders in my cats. The cost of the laxatone is minor compared to the veterinary care one cat required for a "clogged digestive tract" a year ago. ($400+) Amazon's price is lower than my vet's charge for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Janice L Nichols

customer_reviews.title: My cats are obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: My two cats are obsessed with this! They like to lick it directly from the tube! They’ve only been using it for about a month and a half, so it’s hard to say what impact it’s had on hairballs. One of my cats has long fur that she fastidiously grooms. She goes through periods a few times a year where she will cough up a hair all every few days for about a week. So far with this paste, she has only coughed up one hair all, and it was early on. I am interested to see how this continues over the next few months.
customer_reviews.author: ellsari

customer_reviews.title: Effective but not palatable to cat.
customer_reviews.text: Liked the effectiveness of the product. Both flavors the Maple and the Tuna were not the easiest to give to my cats. The Tuna needed a stronger Tuna scent. Product very good for Hairball vomiting and constipation for my older cat. Also recommended by my vet. Product was fresh, long expiration code. Arrived on time in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: One Cat Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended this product for our 18 yr. old cat that seems to be having a problem with throwing up, which the vet thinks is caused by being constipated. I was amazed that the cat loved this right out of the tube. (tuna flavor) She laps it up! We followed the directions and used it as indicated. We skipped yesterday because it now says to give it 2-3 times a week. Well, she did throw up, but not nearly as bad. The other cat wasn't as receptive and it got spilled on the floor. It is sticky so heed this warning if possible. We are pleased with this product and ordered another tube in a larger size. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it and hairball has stopped at all.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for almost a year now with my two cats and they love this product. At the beginning they where very worry about it at the veterinary office, but after I started to administrated it to them at home they really looks forward for it. They even know is time for their dose of it when they see me in my way to get the bottle. I love that my cats stopped vomiting and having hairball vomit episodes, I am so glad they are better and more relaxed.
customer_reviews.author: Mirene Rosas Feliciano

customer_reviews.title: My cat gaged after I opened the tube!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is very particular. I have been looking for a hairball prevention solution for years. Purchased this item because it was recommended by my vet and is considered the industry standard. My cat "helped" me open the box from Amazon, sniffed the tube of Laxatone. I then opened the tube, took off the seal and my cat gagged and ran away. A few days later I put a bit on my finger for him to sniff. Again he gagged. I am going to see if this company has a money back guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: nanabell

customer_reviews.title: Zoe eats this product right out of the tube!
customer_reviews.text: After trying many different lubricant products over the years to control Zoe's fur balls, this product delivered!! She loves the tuna flavor. At age 16, she has become even more finicky about what she eats than when younger. More importantly, her stools are softer and I can actually see fur coming through. She hasn't choked up a fur ball since I began giving her the project over a week ago. I'm giving her a little more than is recommended and have seen only positive results. Also, she has more energy because her tummy isn't upset!
customer_reviews.author: Wannbe writer

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this fur ball fighting product, so it is easy to give it to her. Plus, the product truly seems to work, as I have not witnessed her having to struggle to get rid of a fur ball orally since I started giving her this product.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Porter

customer_reviews.title: Happy cat.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2 year old boy cat due to him vomiting fur balls. We also bought a deshedding tool. We used this one time before the brush arrived. Our cat loved it and took it with no problem. I can't review the effectiveness because the deshedding brush worked well enough for us. We wanted a natural method and have stuck with the brush since. But I will say that the way he ate it, and loved it was a pleasant surprise so we kept it in the case we need it in the future .
customer_reviews.author: Eber & Tiffany Salcido

customer_reviews.title: Bad consistency, Bad flavor
customer_reviews.text: My cat usually enjoys maple-flavored medicine, but he wouldnt take more than a single lick of this stuff. For one, it’s too thick and sticky for him to get more than a lick in let alone a whole serving. Also, the maple flavor is so strong I think it’s overwhelming for him. I tried putting it on his food and even tried watering down the consistency but nothing changed. He hates it. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Explosive mess
customer_reviews.text: I read the other reviews about this stuff exploding out of the tube and decided to risk it anyway, which I should not have done. Can't tell you if it works or not as it did not matter how I stored this thing- right side up, upside down, laying down, etc. No matter the position, the gooey junk was everywhere so into the trash it went.
customer_reviews.author: jad23

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: My cat goes crazy for this stuff!! He absolutely loves it. He doesn't have hairballs (that I know of), but my vet recommended this to help with his large bowel movements that were causing him to strain (which would make him vomit). He's been doing better, and it helps that this is just like a really delicious treat to him.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: This works great.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this. It works for her. The lid leaks though. Where ever I store it I always find a mess. Addition to my last post: The new tube I bought does no leak. Also my cat prefers the maple flavor compared to the tuna flavored one. I couldn't get her to eat the tuna one. She loves the maple one and it works, no hairballs!! The flavors are written in small print so watch what you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: taste
customer_reviews.text: I use Laxatone to give my cat medicine. I crush the tablet really fine and mix the Laxatone with it. She loves the taste of it and doesn't taste the medicine. Before finding Laxatone I had to hold her down and shove the pill way back into her throat which was very traumatic for both of us. She is our baby and this makes it so much better for her to get the medicine she needs. I am so glad we discovered Laxatone Gel!
customer_reviews.author: penquin

customer_reviews.title: Dog Constipated? Use Laxatone!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for at least the past 8-10 years for a few of my dogs that suffered from occasional constipation which can be very painful for many animals. It works beautifully! Usually only 2-3 doses will do the trick. It also must taste very good because all of the dogs I've given it to will lick the dark, amber colored gell right from my finger. Thankfully, constipation does not occur very often (if it did, you need to see a Vet), so the Laxatone works quickly and easily and is preserved in the toothpaste-like tube for an extended period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Iris M. Hageney

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: My cat has severe constipation problems but no underlying health issues that the vet could tell. He's had to stay at the vet for days getting enemas and fluids because he was so blocked up. He enjoys the taste of the laxative like it's a treat so we only have to put some on our finger and he'll lick it off. We use this laxative everyday now and even though his poops are still harder than optimal, he isn't getting painfully constipated. Great for cats who need a little extra help moving everything along.
customer_reviews.author: flickagal07

customer_reviews.title: It Worked Well
customer_reviews.text: I had a sick little kitty and my wildlife rehabber friend recommended this product and brand. When it came I put some on her paws and she licked it off. She seemed to like the flavor. The next day she wasn't constipated and felt much better. I gave some to my other cat too just to prevent hairballs. She liked it also. I will always keep this on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Holly K. West

customer_reviews.title: Cats (mostly) love the taste and has reduced incidence of hairballs
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 cats and the one with the most problems likes this... Sometimes. Other times he wants none of it (but he gets it anyway). The other 3 cats love it all the time, come running when they hear me open the thing like it's a treat. And we have had maybe one hairball (between all four of them) since 2-3 days after we started it. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: The best hairball treatment on the market!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this stuff! He'd suck it straight from the tube if I let him. Aside from that, it works better than any other product I've tried for him over the years. It's getting much harder to find Laxatone on the market, so I was super happy to see it available from Amazon. My 17-year old, long haired man-cat was thrilled to get his "treat" back again, too.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Larke

customer_reviews.title: Product was highly undesirable to pet
customer_reviews.text: After quite the ordeal to even obtain this item due to Amazon delivery catastrophes, I found that my cat not only was very much not interested in the scent or flavor, but would try to run as far away from me if she smelled the scent of the product. I am sure the product is very good, but it's too foreign of a substance and smell for the cat.
customer_reviews.author: pizelli

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves tuna not this laxatone
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time and cost is comparable to others purchased. Bought because of the tuna flavor. Hope it would be accepted more readily by our cat. She smelled it and ran away. (By the was, she loves anything tuna). I tried adding a small amount to the tuna and she wouldn't eat. Searching for another way to avoid hairballs.
customer_reviews.author: tashnell

customer_reviews.title: Great for your Kitties!
customer_reviews.text: My cats are VERY FINICKY so it’s really not fair for me to give a rating on flavor. I really have to hide it in a dab of wet food. I’ve used this product before. They seem to throw up less but still have the gag reflex...but I have one spoiled male cat that really sheds and he demands grooming from his Lady. Value is GREAT tho. Shipment was FAST.
customer_reviews.author: Debra C.

customer_reviews.title: Most helpful treat I could ever find
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought Laxatone for the first time, my cat's stomach was irritated from the amount of hair she was trying to digest. She was struggling. She kept throwing up not only when she was getting rid of hairballs, so I was researching products. I am honestly glad I came over this one. She is still throwing up hair balls from time to time, but rarely. And the Laxatone helped a lot. She also loves the taste, it serves more as a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Likeable

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: Initially, my cat didn't want any part of this gel. But I mixed it with his food a few times and slowly transitioned to just the gel and now he goes completely nuts for it!! I got it to help reduce how many hair balls he gets, and I'm not sure that it's done much if anything to reduce them... but as a post-dinner treat he love it!
customer_reviews.author: acl113

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I had been having issues with hairballs from each of my two large cats. Messy, gross, and no fun for them or me. A twice daily dose of this stuff mixed into their food stopped it completely and seems to have made them more regular, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: My cat thinks he's getting a special treat
customer_reviews.text: This hairball treatment is very appetizing to my (medium hair) cat - unlike other "medications". Giving it to him is so easy.. Since we started using this product, I've noticed fewer hairballs. This is an item I will definitely reorder.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: A Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Due to the Covid-19 situation, I have not been able to get my cat to the groomer for her usual 'Lion Cut'. When I get up in the morning, I give abut 1-2 tsp of Vetoquinol Laxatone: Oral Hairball Lubricant Gel for Cats. She takes it a treat/appetizer before breakfast. It has been effective in controlling hairballs.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Wright

customer_reviews.title: Made me wonder
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats and I buy the same product since years and normally I have always been satisfied; however this time one of my two pet absolutely refused to eat it. The second pet did eat it, but kept on vomiting. So I do not know if it were a very specific problem of the single item, or if the company changed the formula.
customer_reviews.author: Nicoletta Shane

customer_reviews.title: The cats seem to like it and it’s effective.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has helped my babies not to have hair balls. I’ve been dosing it out with a dab mixed into their wet food about every other day. They haven’t seemed to notice. I felt this was the best route to ensure they ingested it and also got used to the flavor. Who knows. Maybe they actually like it?! I got the maple one.
customer_reviews.author: teri

customer_reviews.title: OH! DEAR!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for years and it has always been fine and my cat really seems to enjoy it. BUT this last shipment was different. The first 2 tubes were fine, then he didn't want to eat the dose from either of the last 2 tubes. I mixed it with his food (usually he just laps it right up straight out of the tube) but now he even leaves it mixed with his favorite foods
customer_reviews.author: Linda Dunnican

customer_reviews.title: Maple Syrup Breath Kitty!
customer_reviews.text: My baby thinks this is a treat! She loves it and licks it directly from the squeeze tube as she isn't patient enough for me to put it in anything. It's great for its purpose, but also, it makes her breath smell so good!!! Like maple syrup!!! We're on our 4th tube and will continue using it...
customer_reviews.author: AnOmali™

customer_reviews.title: FUR BALLS
customer_reviews.text: Sierra seemed a little upset with the taste, but shes a trooper and has been taking it. She continues to have fur balls being coughed up, especially at night, but there is a slight decrease in episodes.
customer_reviews.author: Tamera Pagett

customer_reviews.title: Surpising
customer_reviews.text: I honestly didn't think my cat would eat this. I thought I would have to hide it in his food. BUT, he licked it right off my finger and it worked like a charm! The downside was, the tube wasn't completely full, so I feel like the cost didn't measure up to the amount. The tube was only half full.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Really Works
customer_reviews.text: My cat DEMANDS that I give her this EVERY morning and night. She literally grabs my arm as I'm opening the tube. I tried another brand when I could not find Vetoquinol in the pet stores locally, and it was a no go! I'm happy I found it on Amazon. It seems to be the only thing that prevents upchucks!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Black

customer_reviews.title: If nothing else has worked, try this
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe it worked. I have tried three different things including the gold standard Bayer product that I used 4 times and never worked. I applied it to her food. I bought some 'soups' which she loves, stirred it in, she didn't reject it, ate every bite and 4 days later, I didn't notice any more bits on her sleeping area!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa_The_Scot

customer_reviews.title: Definitely helps with hairballs!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats that don't cough up hairballs. They just seem to choke on them. I put this laxatone in a syringe (without a needle) and squirt it in the side of the mouth. They seem to be doing a lot better. Less gagging.
customer_reviews.author: PAM

customer_reviews.title: My cats refused to eat it.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it was not the fault of the product. Cats can be peculiar sometimes. I bought this hairball remedy because it has good rating on Amazon. Both of my cats refused to eat it. I later found another tube of hairball remedy (a different brand) in the drawer. The two cats ate it right away. So this product is not my cats' cup of tea.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Wu

customer_reviews.title: Yup! Picky Cat Approves
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Happy cat is no longer gagging. I recommend pairing with the CatDancer original interactive cat Toy. It's gonna be a great cat weekend.
customer_reviews.author: MimiNVA

customer_reviews.title: My cat actually likes this!
customer_reviews.text: He will lick this right out of the tube as noted by another customer. Different from other products over the years that had to be wiped on his paws in order for him to get it down. Combined with more brushing, he is having only rare vomiting of hairballs. I will be ordering this from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Koenigsamen

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory results.
customer_reviews.text: This product was suggested by our feline's vet. She grooms herself all day at the slightest touch from family. Also, as soon as she eats. The resulting hairballs caused very frequent regurgitation of food and bile. This was daily and often more than once per day. Using Vetoquinol Laxatone has reduced the regurgitation by about 80% while allowing the fur to pass in her stool. Our vet also recommended several small feedings per day. This seems to have helped in conjunction with the Laxatone. Our cat is now about 11 years old and is doing well for her age.
customer_reviews.author: Calgal

customer_reviews.title: cat hates it
customer_reviews.text: this has a super strong molasses smell to it, and its really off-putting. The cat wants nothing to do with this stuff. Since its super thick it doesn't want to mix into wet food. Its easier to put a pill down the cats throat then it is to get the cat to consume this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Great stool softener
customer_reviews.text: My cat is on a prescription diet that cause his bowel movements to be drier and harder to pass. This works very well by given every few days for maintenance. It only took 2 days in row to get him going more normally. He licks most of it himself. He does like the tuna the better than the maple.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: My cat hates this stuff and refuses to eat it
customer_reviews.text: I've tried all sorts of tricks to get my cat to eat this stuff, but he won't. I tried putting it on his food but he eats around it. I put it on his paws and he eventually licks it off but then avoids me for the rest of the day. If you're curious what it looks like, it comes out of the tube like thick dark orange maple syrup
customer_reviews.author: Daron Levy

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be tasty to cats
customer_reviews.text: My 18 year old cat actually likes the taste of this. She has rejected other brands I've bought to help her with hairball control, so I was gratified to see that I'd chosen one that works for her.
customer_reviews.author: Fane

customer_reviews.title: Works and comes fast
customer_reviews.text: I have aging cats who started vomiting hairballs and meals very unpleasantly. I now give them a little Laxatone once a day (not following directions but its easier for me to remember if on daily schedule) and the vomiting has greatly reduced tho not disappeared. New containers are delivered in very timely fashion after being ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Vanderesq

customer_reviews.title: My cat licks this straight outta the tube!
customer_reviews.text: My cat will lick this straight out of the tube! No need to make a mess by putting it on her paws or nose. Sit will sit in my lap and lick until I take it away. Then she will purr like crazy because she thinks she just had a treat. I don’t know if it works yet, but she will take it without fuss as a minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty homeowner

customer_reviews.title: Literally a life saver
customer_reviews.text: My 19 year old cat is extremely picky when it comes to food. In his old age he has also become quite constipated..even when giving him wet food. I mix a dime size amount of this into his wet food twice a day. Never thought I would be so happy to see poop in a regular basis!
customer_reviews.author: Eliza

customer_reviews.title: Hairball gel
customer_reviews.text: Its one of the few brands I can get my cat to eat. I still have to mix it with her food but at least she doesn't walk away from her food dish like the others I've tried. She is extremely picky. Putting it on her paw never worked as she shakes it off all over the house. Only comment I have is I wish it was a bit thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia J. Frazzetta

customer_reviews.title: This works! My cat loves the tuna flavor.
customer_reviews.text: This really works for my 18 yr old cat. She gets a lot of hairballs and if I keep her on this consistently, she's fine. She's really finicky but she happens to love this, tuna flavor. It's also a lot cheaper on Amazon than it is at the vet's office.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara P.

customer_reviews.title: Tuna flavor had no tuna flavor.
customer_reviews.text: This works, but the TUNA flavor I received does not have even a hint of tuna flavor! I have to mix it really well with a tuna bisque (cat food, but real food that is like a thick gravy). Even then my cat has to be really hungry to eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Cockatiels R Us

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my daughters 9 yr old cat. She is so finicky and balked when my daughter tried to give her some from her finger, so she put a little in her food bowl and she gobbled it right up. Also , I'm not sure if its recommended, but she keeps it in the fridge. Now the cat thinks its a treat. She gets it about 2 times a week. I will purchase this again. I'm fairly certain this is the same stuff I used to use for my own cats that was prescribed by my vet back in the day.
customer_reviews.author: T.M.

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good for my 20 year old cat for constipation
customer_reviews.text: Will be reordering very shortly so far so good seems to be working okay for my 20 year old cat she has major constipation and has been to the vet many times due to the situation.. Although personally I do not think this is the only solution because she still struggles with constipation but I can see that it has helped her.
customer_reviews.author: Im,late

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love this! (Tuna flavor) They lick it right out of the tube! I guess it works ok. Seldom do we have hairballs. I have one that upchucks quite often, but she's part goat...eats everything she sees! I think it's expensive, but it was suggested by our vet when one of them was sick, so we just continued using it.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My cat has problems with hairballs every spring for at least 3 months. I have her on hairball food but this is not enough to stop the problem. This product really works and she likes the maple flavor better than the chicken.
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried similar products, by mixing it in with a little canned cat food, but my cat would not eat it. I do the same thing with this, and she eats it every time. Later that day or so, I'll find a hairball, so this stuff really works!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my cat who we suspected to have a bowel obstruction. He had been throwing up for days and hadn't pooped. After two days of this it was all cleared up!
customer_reviews.author: Michaela H.

customer_reviews.title: Works for dogs too!
customer_reviews.text: My vet said this stuff is for cats but sold us a tube to try and dislodge a piece of toy our blue heeler swallowed as it's drastically cheaper then the surgery option. We used a decent amount more then you would for a cat. Maybe a table spoon and some, a couple doses over a day or 2. It worked great so I ordered a second tube to keep as back up. Darn puppies.
customer_reviews.author: John collier

customer_reviews.title: Two Paws Up.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried other hairball products and my cat wouldn’t touch it, so my vet gave me a similar product (maple flavor) and my cat actually liked it. Found this on Amazon (cheaper then the vets) and my cat actually begs for it. I do have to put it on a plate, she won’t eat it off my finger or her paw.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Picky eater, wont eat unless I shove my finger in his mouth.
customer_reviews.text: My picky eater wont eat this unless i force him too. But on the plus side it does work, he hasnt thrown up since i started giving him this and its been a month now. so its does in fact work.
customer_reviews.author: Lila Q.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, high price
customer_reviews.text: We use this product for our long hair tortie cat. She frequently gets hairballs, even with regular brushing. This helps prevent her hairballs, and reduces the amount of vomiting occurring. This product arrived in a timely manner, but the price has increased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cat would not eat
customer_reviews.text: It was so thick that cat would not eat it. Put on nose, no luck. Put on paw, no luck. Just tracked over porch. Put with food, no luck. Total waste of money for my cat. Maybe some cats will take to it, but not mine.
customer_reviews.author: 68 year-old

customer_reviews.title: Shipped on time /cat didn't like the flavor in my case
customer_reviews.text: Packaging looks good, received it on time, unfortunately it was a battle to get my cat to take it and it didn't work for him in his case, which is why it's one star for value. By all means the company is good, as the Lysine bites were a bit easier to feed but the results were as advertised for that product. Just sharing my personal experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vetoquinol Tuna Laxatone - Good Price and Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: My cat was bringing up hairballs and food just about everyday. I took her to the Vet and he sold me this product ($9 for a 2.25 oz tube). I squeeze some up, and my cat licks it right out of the tube. I give her a little bit a few times per week. She goes many weeks now without a hairball. The Laxatone helps the hair move through the digestive system so it can be eliminated in the litter box. I hesitated to order this item from this seller because the picture doesn't match the actual tube, but it is the same product. Needless to say, I'll be ordering here from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy M

customer_reviews.title: BEST Hair Ball Medicine!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hair ball meds for your cat because it makes the hair go through the stomach so they can poo it out or if bad with hair balls help throw up all the hair balls. The TUNA is the best one for them so give this a try for your cats they will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Just like what I buy at the vet for a better price. I suggest putting it on the inside front wrist of the cat where the thumb is located and let them lick it off. Works great and like its suppose to.
customer_reviews.author: angel

customer_reviews.title: 2 Cat's Don't Like Taste
customer_reviews.text: I give it a 3 because my cat's didn't like the taste, but nothing was wrong with the product. I am so tired trying to find a "laxatone" product my cats like. My elderly cat hates all of them so much she doesn't clean her fur on both her front legs anymore where I HAVE to put it. Unfortunately, I have to use it as she had major surgery 3 years ago because a "petrified" fur ball was blocking her intestines and almost killed her!
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat demands it multiple times every day.
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was quick, and the price was right. My 16 year old cat eats a tube of this in about 2 months. Addicted. She likes the malt flavor. Has been "using" for most of her life.
customer_reviews.author: Pictomaniac

customer_reviews.title: Licks right out of tube
customer_reviews.text: Our 10 year old ragdoll cat loves the taste of this and licks it right from the tube. I've noticed a slight decrease in hairballs and throwing up. Gave 4 starts because tube can get messy.
customer_reviews.author: wimom

customer_reviews.title: My Cats will not eat this Maple Flavor
customer_reviews.text: I just opened this package because I ran out of the chicken flavor, which is what I thought I ordered originally. My cats do NOT like this maple flavor at all. Now I am stuck with a whole tube.
customer_reviews.author: Chuckster1

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't just help a kitty with fur balls!!
customer_reviews.text: Approved by 2 out of 3 cats in my household!! Not only does it work for hairballs, but older cats with mild to severe kidney issues often have difficulty pooping. This stuff REALLY helps the poor senior kitties out and makes it much easier for them!!
customer_reviews.author: Aileen D.

customer_reviews.title: Maggie Gives a Paws Up on Laxatone
customer_reviews.text: My elderly cat Maggie doesn't do as thorough a job cleaning herself, so she appreciates having a squeeze of Laxatone in her food once a day. It really does reduce hairballs and tummy problems.
customer_reviews.author: Storydeva

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves the Tuna One
customer_reviews.text: I bought the tuna flavored one for my cat. I don't need to out it on her paw or somehow trick her into eating it - she'll eat it plain off of a plate or my finger. She hasn't had any hairballs since I've started using it, either.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Horrible flavor
customer_reviews.text: Maple flavor is probably the worst idea possible for a cat. My cat wouldn’t touch it. Wish it were something I could send back. I wasted my money :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You ask me to rate FLAVOR? I have not tasted it and cats do not speak human so...Dumb Question! Yes?
customer_reviews.text: This product may be a great one for some cats. But mine, as I am sure is the case for many, just isn't interested. The taste and smell do not capture her finicky attention.
customer_reviews.author: Toni K Pacini

customer_reviews.title: Great to Reduce Hairballs
customer_reviews.text: My Turkish Angora cat loves this flavor. His long hair coat sometimes creates lots of hairballs in the shedding months. I use this and butter to prevent them, as he eats mostly fresh or really good canned food.
customer_reviews.author: Sekhmet2

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price.
customer_reviews.text: My 18 year old cats love this product. It helps them with hair balls and the constipation they have because of their age. Their vet recommended this product and the price is better buying through Amazon. The seller was great. It came when promised in perfect condition. I will order again from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: hydrangea girl

customer_reviews.title: Fussy cat but it works for her
customer_reviews.text: Noticed a significant difference in my elderly cat and her elimination issues. She’s been going easier and with less fuss. Still a fight with her to take it, she’s always been fussy.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Great for hair balls
customer_reviews.text: We have been giving this too our 2 cats for years, just a little bit on my finger each morning and they seem too like the flavor, a tube lasts a long time,great product.
customer_reviews.author: siam

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Packaging Fail
customer_reviews.text: This product works great for my cat with frequent hairballs. However the lid does not seal properly and the product leaks out and makes a giant mess. It also wastes a large amount of product. It doesn't matter how I store it or how tightly I close the lid. I wish this was sold in a different container.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes the flavor.
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to give some of these ingredients to my cat (petroleum products), but this is what my vet recommends. The hairballs are still coming up, so don't expect miracles, but I can see improvement after a few days. I also feed him sardines packed in olive oil, which he loves, and which was a recommended natural cure.
customer_reviews.author: Borrowed Time

customer_reviews.title: This review is from my cats
customer_reviews.text: Two of my three cats actually come running when I pull out the tube - and it's the two that need it. They love it, even though I can tell it's quite thick. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Roses in Grayslake

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Very palatable and easy to use. Really helps minimize cat vomiting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better
customer_reviews.text: Cat loves it, and no hairballs! My cat is 16 yrs old and it seemed like her hairball problem was getting worse. This seems like a quick, safe remedy.
customer_reviews.author: Bar fly now Mama

customer_reviews.title: It is petroleum based
customer_reviews.text: Better than soy based, but read the ingredients then try Cat Lax, the best. I purchased all of this through Amazon and based my decision on Amazon reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Pocket Wolf

product_meta.title: Vetoquinol Laxatone: Oral Hairball Lubricant Gel for Cats, 4.25oz
feature_bullets: Gentle and easy-to-use digestive lubricant for helping prevent and eliminate hairballs in cats
Delicious tuna oral hairball lubricant gel easily helps cats pass hairballs in litter box
Our Laxatone coats swallowed hair to help it pass through the digestive tract easily
For best results, apply a small amount of feline hairball gel on your cat's nose or paws daily
Your furry friend will love their hairball lubricant since it's tasty & helps them feel better

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
